channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report E-2023080029
item.description:
Report E-2023080029

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During loading there was no signs of product leaking. Driver moved to the customer scale on site and noticed the turpentine smell and then saw a leak coming from the bottom forward section of the insulation through a weep hole. Driver moved it to the customer containment area on site. We formulated a game plan with the shipper to transfer it in to a new trailer. We also brought in a response team to 'diaper' the trailer in the interim to help contain it. The transload was successful and the trailer stopped leaking and was cleaned and put on the train back to Chicago.

Safety plugs in these cans do not hold/prevent seepage when cans not upright. Product bagged, but spilled liquid escaped bags DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in slavage drum

item.title: Report E-2023080103
item.description:
Report E-2023080103

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPO experienced a UN1463 Chromium Trioxide release from a 110-pound metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released impacting a 2' x 2' area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The released product, damaged pail, and impacted pallet pieces were collected and containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

THE PACKAGE CAME TO QA LOOKING TO HAVE BEEN LOADED ON SIDE AT PREVOUS LOCATION. ALL EXCESS LIQUID ABSORBED BY THE BOX.   • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking with bottom torn out, removed from sortation and brought to QA. DescribePack: Bottom of box tore along edges, no inner packing, contents fell out and leaked. Two jugs leaking from caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought to appropriate damage processing area.

Report X-2023080024

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE SOUND OF RATTLING AEROSOL CANS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 12 X 10.14 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF NEON UNIVERSAL GAS LIGHTER PREMIUM BUTANE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023080226
item.description:
Report X-2023080226

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: SALEM
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Contents was brought to QA, upon inspection, opening the content in a repack FedEx box. there were 4 jugs of Just Right Heavy Duty Degreaser. 3 of the 4 jugs were in large ziploc bags, the 4th jug was not. Upon further inspection, a team member noticed that there was a slow leak on the bottom of 1 of the jugs, possibly punctured during transit. Before finding out it was a possible LQ, there were no labels indicating that it was Corrosive liquid or a hazmat on the repack box. DescribePack: The contents were originally packed in one large trash bag and inside was four individual plastic bags. the one that was punctured was no contained in a bag. the puncture was located at the bottom of the jug missing the product label. There was not much protection between the box and the jugs. They appeared to be just double bagged. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Contents was inspected, attempt to mitigate further leakage, by adding absorbent sheets on the bottom of the leaking jug, until dealt with properly.
